alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Northumberland; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of central King and Queen, northwestern Northumberland, southern Richmond, northwestern New Kent, southeastern Hanover, central King William and southeastern Essex Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 254 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tappahannock to near Studley. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Rainfall 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall may cause minor flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Tappahannock around 300 PM EDT. Warsaw around 305 PM EDT. Haynesville and Farnham around 315 PM EDT. Aylett around 325 PM EDT. King William and Callao around 330 PM EDT. Saint Stephens Church around 335 PM EDT. Stevensville around 345 PM EDT. King And Queen Court House and Millers Tavern around 350 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Enfield, Lottsburg, Upright, Ino, Cohoke, Westwood, Rose Garden, Biscoe, Tidewater and Crouch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Northumberland; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen
